F2E5B7527B8A400588237810F525F0A5.description: Create and manage files and folder structures.

4472E18C37374380AEF745A2621B3D71.description: Save work regularly and keep information secure.

9511BFCC764045529D5F50A1E1175F74.description: Edit images: image editing, cropping, adding captions/text, editing/deletion of unwanted aspects.

39738F788BF6447584133A1352983BB0.description: Create images: combining basic shapes and text, rectangles (including square), circles (including ovals), lines, triangles, arrows, text boxes.

923170005E614971A7ED641143EDE27B.description: Explain features of image types: bitmap, vector.

5567B316E2EC4B7CBFA91CAEEBFB9D0D.description: Print: handouts (two to a page, three to a page), notes pages, full page, headers and footers.

6CB7564219384778B8491A5086F686AA.description: Create slides: insert text, images, action buttons, hyperlinks; add animation, transition effects.

27E6004BC2B347E68AD674814FACFA7D.description: Create a template/master slide: placeholders, footer, slide number, background, font enhancements (bold, italic, underline).

B9DB6F435F404564842E76EAC0006B06.description: Use HTML code: insert hyperlinks, insert images, font enhancements.

0A5721015A6E4FD4B4DBAE76A3D73B04.description: Format a web page: headings, subheadings, body text, alignment.

72EF04444C494695BF905A2D36A6B963.description: Use a template: tables/frames, standard page features, banners, menu/navigation.

0EC2D35D9068432885E4D84CEFE8D271.description: Print selected columns/rows from a worksheet formula view or data view in landscape or portrait format, adding headers and footers, row and column headers.

A131BFCDDF124BC187DC64C2D90ED4BF.description: Select an appropriate graph/chart and format it effectively adding title, axis labels, legends, axis, scale, trend line as appropriate.

83AE3BA1EFE74817ABFE8B688E4F0045.description: Add graphs and charts: pie chart, line chart, bar/column chart, scattergram.

BF362BAB9CF147CBB44C6A96F73B51D5.description: Use other features: multiple worksheets, sorting, filtering.

643ECDB5AD37486790A9E4E35B655D7B.description: Use functions: SUM, AVERAGE, IF, VLOOKUP /LOOKUP, MAXIMUM, MINIMUM, COUNT (COUNTA, COUNTIF), LENGTH, PRODUCT

C1F49D4421254AEBB76FEE3F261263D4.description: Use formulae: arithmetic operators (plus, minus, multiply, divide), percentage, single operators, multiple operators, absolute and relative cell referencing, named cells/ranges. Replicate effectively.

4E2ABC75EA474A279561568E30C12704.description: Format a worksheet: currency, percentage, decimal places, date, time, text wrap, row height, column width, gridlines, merge/split cells, cell borders, cell shading, hiding rows and columns.

548DD485778F46979C1CD083B4AC520F.description: Produce outputs: reports, mail merge documents, specified fields, design view (table structure, searches/queries, forms, relationships), data view (table, search/query results, forms).

861DF5BC4994430FB1C57DA2E6C29A29.description: Use search/query using single criterion, multiple criteria, search within results, relational operators, logical operators.

5E736EB21F2449C582F901EB96932DB5.description: Input information to given tables or forms applying format consistently.

4EA9627A2CB54EF18A372F144DFB3247.description: Sort using a single field, multiple fields, ascending/descending order.

BDFE76F73ECE4D0895C9F6B26DFA84FE.description: Explain the need for validation and identify validation checks such as range check, presence check, type check, length check.

A3152EA09EAE45EDBD77CC7FF5E5A3D1.description: Explain the structure of a given database, including: record, field, table, primary key/field, foreign key/field, relationships between tables.

E13368A7F8C24D2195FABA46F4A3682C.description: Identify data types: alphanumeric/text, numeric/number, date, currency, logical/Boolean.

3F09A7F6606D4E3BACD5B4107A3447BC.description: Use mail merge: mail merge from word processed, spreadsheet and database documents.

FB2A6ECAD170422E9D05C63CA6CE32DD.description: Use standard conventions: salutation, complimentary close, date, subject, logo.

CE081D9DEE9940A89F9E429B60DD2CFE.description: Produce documents in these document types: letter, report, newsletter, poster, leaflet, information sheet (fact sheet), memo.

439E1ECFC9C144419111791420585A68.description: Integrate in a single document: charts, tables, images, callouts/autoshapes, text from different files, text boxes, grouping, layering (in front of/behind), values from spreadsheets.

72ADC0C879ED4EFF815F5F9682F16706.description: Use page layout: headings, sub-headings, lists, templates, header, footer, portrait, landscape, page breaks, page numbering.

BE833555A50C498EA295F2AFBCE58634.description: Use columns and/or tables: horizontal and vertical text alignment, merge and split cells, gridlines, borders, shading.

D5158BE8A38B47C9B509FDB585CDACAC.description: Enter, edit and format text using: bullets, numbering, sub-numbering, alignment, tabs, line spacing, colour, font size and style, text wrap, text boxes.

3E85EB2ACFF340C89E714A8CBD027EB1.description: Enter or edit text that is appropriate for a given context using accurate spelling, punctuation and grammar.

1D84777218644C1A8F8C0BE4A8AB7207.description: Evaluate the selection, use and effectiveness of ICT tools and facilities used.

84F134485BA949D1ADC0D819CC988335.description: Make modifications to improve the outcomes.

A5F4F79661A5435994030067D6C4D9E3.description: Identify strengths and weaknesses in a digital product and suggest possible improvements.

01C0F6BC59434694ACE86B0B2B288EA6.description: Review the outcomes of the use of software applications by comparing the digital product with the original requirements

AB7B67FFDB7843B08298A17570B1B24F.description: Work accurately and proofread, using software facilities where appropriate for the task.

8092171F0D064B14835312D39E35AAC2.description: Use styles appropriately, including serif and sans serif fonts, colour choice.

EF211B25029A4B42A67D6D01C5677053.description: Produce information that is fit for purpose and audience, using accepted layouts and house styles.

876F4A60423145168BF3FE5E7FBE49AD.description: Enter, organise, develop, refine and format information, applying editing techniques to meet needs.

AD0631A3D01C4A8B915A23A0E289FA46.description: Understand the difference between data and information

D5C226A8B7C2496FA3C2222E127E4B83.description: Select appropriate software applications to meet needs.

B58286440AD4491B98453092A230C2C7.description: Use the following software effectively: • word processing • database management • spreadsheet • web authoring • presentation (multimedia) • graphics.

47D7E9986883465382CE409044E99E5B.description: Understand the features and characteristics of online data storage and local storage.

D0E65C53C74B4D9EAAC0BEC4FFDFDC9D.description: Understand the features and characteristics of hosted applications software and locally installed software.

AD9EA96829A74BEB9976913F2DA32B3A.description: Understand the impact of cloud-based services: hosted applications, storage.

C587A764828D45FE81572766269DB241.description: Understand the features and characteristics of online services and local services.

28760788FECA49C8801773437C654321.description: Know about targeted marketing and personalisation techniques.

114EECF33D5642A5BBF20040BDAA1779.description: Understand how transactional data is collected and used: what is collected, cookies, transaction tracking.

14D7195F3F7C4714A7CC08FECB918497.description: Understand the impact of the internet on the ways that organisations do business.

94AD0957C53841C69D0EE75A666D15E1.description: Understand the impact on an individual’s lifestyle and behaviour of the availability of goods and services online.

D21EFBD9BA9C4D178033049482944047.description: Understand what online services are offered by: • shopping sites – basket, checkout, secure payment, product catalogue • booking systems for travel, leisure and entertainment • banks • education and training providers – VLE, online support, online training courses, remote access • gaming sites • news and other information providers • auction sites • entertainment providers – on demand, streaming, downloads.

045A3CFED90643389CFF5C67203F1174.description: Understand issues related to plagiarism: copy and paste, rewriting, paraphrasing.

BE2271ACCB43424DBAC7BF0A69FAAC58.description: Understand issues related to copyright: permission to use, acknowledgement of source.

A6F836F68D634B5E8BBA557C70003D00.description: Be able to evaluate the fitness for purpose of available information in terms of accuracy, age, relevance, reliability, bias.

15B120790DD845A2AD95234072DB0D1C.description: Know how to use search engines effectively

3D0AB39BA5A24888988DD6A1C129622D.description: Be able to select and use appropriate sources of information.

778ACFCAB4F94B7D9CF073BFFA11D0CD.description: Understand that information can be gathered from a wide range of sources.

C70FF236FDD44BEC843D6B32C6BEF1CD.description: Availability of information online and the use of online information

CE98E004A6934B6594A032D3315A0038.description: Understand the health and safety issues that arise from individuals’ use of ICT and know how they can be minimised.

740848A6EFD1499688B8AE83231F84CA.description: Understand sustainability issues and ways of mitigating the environmental impact of digital devices.

3FB434B9C7B243F4B6E835976A1A9D8F.description: Be aware of safe and responsible practice when using ICT.

5FEFDB7E4FEB42229777982572BE4977.description: Understand that individuals’ movements and communications can be monitored.

1ABB7F335085400CB5BA341123CFA139.description: Understand how copyright legislation affects the use of digital information and media.

377C727D99A343DC90F1A1B019A37C92.description: Know about data protection, the legal requirements of those storing data about individuals and an individual’s legal rights

CEEEAC5585E04C3D9EB24C6714C1504A.description: Implications of the use of digital technologies

F5BE67E849AC4009A6EBC2AC21221E7C.description: Understand how to stay safe online: cyber bullying, anonymity of others (misrepresentation), disclosure of personal information/location.

C4DD1F3053BA4F91BCB474DCC8F54525.description: Be aware of the purpose of responsible use and acceptable behaviour policies.

17A27F77028A497AB5D1CDD9C8C885F6.description: Understand the ways in which online communities are used to communicate and collaborate on a global scale.

5899F39B68C14EC790EA8A9655C31C7D.description: Know the functions and target audience of different forms of online communities.

1E9BC9B479A2427CBD597C66B8D75A11.description: Understand key features of online communities: • social networking • online gaming • online work spaces • virtual learning environments (VLE) • user-generated reference sites: wikis, websites, forums • user-generated content: video sharing sites, blogs, websites • social bookmarking.

5DACEDA927E24145A24697CEE08689FD.description: Understand the impact of changes in ways of socialising.

CD2D9B6C49764A30846E0E36F6AA184A.description: Know about the impact on individuals and communities of limited or no access to digital technologies.

C4CB8FC4E3834C82B45DE7E2E58B05F8.description: Understand the causes and implications of unequal access to ICT (locally, globally).

A9AA87BDE3174466ABE38B0A331D5ADF.description: Know about the gap between information rich and information poor.

9F36B1B91D3441859E75537AAD4895FE.description: Understand the impact on society of the ability of individuals to have less-restricted access to networks at any time.

A8797F7CC98C41F8801E6E3E6ACF06E5.description: Impact of the internet on society

592ADA5411EF4D8399F7435E57669DA0.description: Understand negative impacts: security issues, risk of hacking, greater competition.

089548046FC74FCAB09ACE19D9B821B8.description: Understand positive impacts: improved communication, access to global markets and workforce, changes in the way information is managed and used.

D627CA54602A4DA581E5EB9F111CA362.description: Impact of the internet on organisations

93E7278F688C4627A60894499F7760B8.description: Know the benefits and drawbacks of working from home for individuals and organisations.

A9682BCE9010411EA4DEB5B77C5555D4.description: Understand how the availability of digital devices and the internet enables individuals to work from home.

3DB292DBC3A443D38EC3399A0CDD54F7.description: Understand how to stay safe online.

0B224CE85C844EB194503184F9F5A73F.description: Know about social impacts such as: • reduced social interaction • increases in cyberbullying • reduced physical activity.

B8C18673867B4E5B980D52FE82C61A8F.description: Know about better access to information and services, new ways of learning, and the wider range of entertainment and leisure opportunities.

5C1DD8BBC87E4406BE0BA1ED350659B2.description: Understand the impact on working practices, including collaborative working and flexible or mobile working.

8DA9EF332B3241F093F2DFC8228CB384.description: Know about the impact on employment, such as new job opportunities as the nature of a job changes, new skills requirements, potential job loss.

28F2B5FCF38A40B281879F12675410ED.description: Impact of the internet on individuals

906103ADD0BF4DABAD68600712DB7862.description: Know about online payment systems, third party payment systems, bank cards, contactless payment using NFC and how payments are protected.

4539FEEF8A7447C28B6171F4AF2D9B3D.description: Know about methods available to secure data and personal information online: • firewalls • encryption • passwords, PIN, biometrics, CAPTCHA tests, security questions • anti-malware, anti-virus, anti-adware, anti-spyware • access rights, file permissions • secure websites • not opening email attachments or following web links • backup procedures

1710934479CA4610BA12A5E201F5830B.description: Be aware of risks to data and information: • unauthorised access • deliberate damage by malware • accidental deletion • theft of personal data: phishing, pharming.

B5A54344196448FB95817F78C3C4FBE1.description: Potential risks to data and personal information when information is transmitted and stored digitally

D9C40A85CF4945F0AC539698066E3DA3.description: Be able to select suitable methods of securing data for a particular context

990211C7C5914B35BE6456E04B90C623.description: Know about and understand the use of log-ins and passwords, firewalls, WEP/WPA, encryption, VPN, file access rights, transaction logs and backups.

71FB6DD662EE4BCEA2789168E5593095.description: Securing data on a network, including the internet

02B4C23DE85F47438E3EB90333798197.description: Understand the benefits of using a clientserver network: • control of user access rights • centralised administration • centralised backup • shared software • shared storage and file access • roaming profiles (hotdesk).

6EB734CCB30642729CCB995C3B9680BF.description: Understand the benefits of using local area network: • shared peripherals • shared data • flexible access • media streaming • communication • shared access to the internet.

340AA0BC2C3E407CA6AB85A77AAB8191.description: Know about the role of servers in a clientserver network.

DD6DB29347BE4F15881D366B5637A3F9.description: Know about peer-to-peer and client-server networks.

ACF6960167EB45D4ABC484916E3503AC.description: Benefits of using a LAN/home network

2B52735A22324EE8A363FC966B47594C.description: Know the role of these for connecting to and using the internet: • web browser • ISP • search engine • filter software

77DC47EAE4424F35BB562CC672522AC4.description: Understand the function of components of wired and wireless systems: cable, wireless access point, router, gateway, booster, server.

A372A862B50A46F7BC9504883A83AB0B.description: Know about network operating systems and how devices are identified on a network: device name, internet protocol (IP) and Media Access Control (MAC).

07C6AB09E3E946E3875E4FCCB73AE5EA.description: Requirements for connecting to a network, including the internet

CDA99539B5AB4CB0A98B54E82429B55D.description: Understand the features of broadband, mobile broadband and cellular networks.

DDFFEE7A42634A7D85EF7A999F9815EE.description: Understand the significance of bandwidth and latency, and their impact on the ‘user experience’.

0DBFBE4C14854D3495599ECABAF18128.description: Understand the benefits and drawbacks of wired versus wireless communication in local networks.

780AC2E5C9B44691BAB21E1E2B076A92.description: Understand factors influencing the speed and volume of data transfer.

F7083AE39F5C42D5B8E3A232A0CD2C6B.description: Factors influencing the choice of digital communication in a network

7E81D476979F41E3A15D7A97647B18F6.description: Know the differences between Wi-Fi and Bluetooth and when each is best used.

FBEFB08FE34F4C298F624C1475B2D0EA.description: Know the types of wireless communication: Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, 3G, 4G, infra-red (IR), near-field communication (NFC)

4D619885CBE044C6AC2B32232FBFB187.description: Know that digital devices can communicate device to device and by using networks: local area network (LAN), wide area network (WAN), personal area network (PAN), tethering.

C34BE90B9B2F442284E3C7C308BBF3A2.description: Know the range of ways that digital devices communicate: satellite, broadcast (TV, radio), wired (cable), wireless

A6AEF882D1D14EB8BBC62528DFBDFA48.description: Be able to justify choices made in identifying and configuring hardware and software.

61DD81E7FAF2447C87BE5F84A5DE8D01.description: Understand that settings of ICT systems can be configured to meet the accessibility needs of individuals.

1301D058443140159A42E0AA82993C6C.description: Be able to identify appropriate software that meets specified needs.

54E208AF67C14FF09B46A6930984835E.description: Be able to identify digital devices and associated peripheral devices that meets particular needs, including accessibility.

BC162246D2D5419CA187BE6FFDD63FA3.description: ICT systems to meet specified needs

66B23462B2E74E6BBCE3F98831DAA695.description: Know how the speed of a processor is measured.

D788F98E881142E1B4AD5A7B95698E16.description: Understand the function of the processing unit (CPU).

CF051670F22347AFBF87872617FC566F.description: Be able to describe the characteristics and uses of flash memory.

1A3BAF61BE9E4F81A493574F34A45117.description: Be able to describe the characteristics of RAM and ROM, the differences between them and the impact on the user of the size of ROM/RAM.

B88565F9D64B45CD93DAAECA2AF20C9F.description: Know that RAM stands for Random Access Memory and that ROM stands for Read Only Memory

2B5FE7C3664A412C87D7C01FD5B3DA11.description: Understand the terms describing the capacity of storage such as bit, byte and multiples of these (kibibytes, mebibytes, gibibytes, tebibytes) (using 1KiB = 1024 bytes).

35DE9E79E6F64A4F8644423911A3835A.description: Know that storage media can be recordable / write once (R) and rewritable (R/W)

B70AA145D68547FEBCD8C3A94E6B6200.description: Know about types of storage media such as hard disks, optical disks (CD, DVD, Blu-ray), flash memory devices, magnetic tape

9E5F5FF558BE4D7C98040C582B7201CB.description: Know that storage devices can be internal or external.

DB01891AC7D44C7F89DF2D145B6DABA3.description: Know the characteristics of hard disk drives (HDD), solid state drives (SSD), optical disk drives.

508AD28A69A744D9A20A19E4F1DCC882.description: Be able to differentiate between storage devices and the media used to store data.

BEAB017272D0419FB0B3E9020B334F8A.description: Know about types of input peripheral such as keyboard, mouse, tracker ball, joystick, graphics tablet, scanner, digital camera, webcam, microphone, touch screen, OMR reader, OCR reader, bar code scanner, biometric scanner, magnetic stripe reader, chip and pin, sensor and when they would be used.

0AE8F44E2CE24741A985237AE88D699A.description: Know about types of output peripheral such as monitor (screen size, resolution), printer (laser, inkjet, 3D), plotter, data projector, speaker, control device and when they would be used.

76A522654BF04D91A00896ED52AAE1C6.description: Types of peripheral devices – input and output

D9995FBCCD724F8A9111BCC522B43A11.description: Know why software is updated, how it is done and possible risks to data/systems.

8C976345A46F4468B73AA4484BF3B8B6.description: Understand that the purpose of communication software is to provide remote access to systems and to exchange files and messages in text, images, audio and/or video formats between different computers or users.

C4F9F013CADC43E8AC74F50A8946A8A1.description: Know about software licensing types (free/open source and proprietary software).

69D60F891941438EA4E8434CF9D76743.description: Know about software applications (apps), including office-productivity tools, web authoring, image and sound editing, presentation software, control software, project management software.

FE6520A6B05A4E4F84C4D090FED384BC.description: Know about the role/function of the operating system, including basic knowledge of: • single user and network • memory management • resource management • security • print spooling.

BA114918983C4FBB89609E8AEBA86CCF.description: Know about operating systems and system software tools such as utilities.

5B78A30683134DE3B798249062B68C0E.description: Be able to identify the purpose of systems software and applications software.

CD211EFDFA8540CFADCB71FC7AED8752.description: Students need to know the types of software used in digital devices. They need to be able to identify the differences between system software and application software. They need to know the types of software applications that are available.

5234D6F660FF4A579869699ADB97FE8A.description: Be able to discuss the features of identified digital devices.

34920B3E7F764F65B1EA3FA0AAFD1AC7.description: Understand features of digital devices: portability, performance, storage, user interface, connectivity, media support, energy consumption, expansion capability, security features.

757481D2A6B44C4E81874C33FE7325C7.description: Identify the processes, skills and approaches used by practitioners to create performance work, with limited reference to examples of repertoire.

33AD83416D4449228BB69CE7124BB20B.description: Outline the interrelationships between components used in performance, with reference to limited examples of repertoire.

B1A91BBD6D014EC38D2259A88D690C13.description: Understand the terms ‘multifunctional’ (e.g. mobile phones that include a camera, have limited game playing functionality and GPS) and ‘convergence’ (e.g. functionality of smartphones and tablet devices becomes more similar) in the context of digital devices.

2570BA07D16F47D29545A6DFCFDD9A0C.description: Know about navigation aids and how they are used.

D3390ECD5568499A856BF10B6BE9A454.description: Be able to describe the purpose and use of other digital devices such as: • cameras and camcorders • games consoles • home entertainment systems • media players.

CF6EC0A3C0854624A07D0F1971A29FAB.description: Know about types of mobile phones; smartphones and specialist phones and how they connect to the network (SIM).

4EF57C4244E1442CB39462C7992E0E07.description: Understand that laptop and desktop computers are types of personal computers. Some laptops are used as desktop replacements.

31F5C247C53E408BA27C03005E76D42C.description: Be aware that mainframe computers are used for complex processing tasks and microprocessors are embedded in products such as washing machines.

7270BA4BFA194BC383B36D4C945736A4.description: INTERNATIONAL GCSE Information and Communication Technology (ICT) (9-1)
